DOC.brief_summary: We must implement 8 implantable cardioverter defibrillators (ICDs) to save a life in 3 years after myocardial infarction (MI) in primary prevention. Only the ejection fraction of the left ventricle (LVEF) is used as a tool for risk stratification of sudden death after myocardial infarction. Several studies have shown that impairment of spontaneous baroreflex sensitivity (BRS) after MI was predictor of sudden death.
DOC.brief_title: Assessment of Spontaneous Baroreflex Sensitivity in Carriers of Implantable Cardioverter Defibrillators: Association With Disorders of the Ventricular Heart Rate. Case-control Study
DOC.criteria: Patients implanted with an implantable cardioverter defibrillators for primary prevention of ischemic heart disease with ejection fraction of the left ventricle ≤ 35% Ejection fraction of the left ventricle ≤ 35% Age ≥ 18 years Patients with disorders of the ventricular heart rate recorded by the implantable cardioverter defibrillators and not older than 2 years Implantable cardioverter defibrillators patient carrier for at least 3 years. Lack of disorders of ventricular heart rate in the memories of the implantable cardioverter defibrillators in the last three years prior to study entry Patient electrodriven, Patients with cardiac disease other qu'ischémique, Manifest impossibility of a collection of stationary signal Finapres: Atrial fibrillation, many premature, unsuccessful execution of verticalization, Important metabolic disorders such as ketoacidosis or dyskaliémie (<3.5 or> 5 mmol / L) Age <18 years
